docs.lead_paragraph: Chemical maker DuPont reported lower sales in all of its businesses and said a strong dollar would take a bigger toll on its full-year earnings than it had expected.

docs.snippet: Chemical maker DuPont reported lower sales in all of its businesses and said a strong dollar would take a bigger toll on its full-year earnings than it had expected.

docs.lead_paragraph: “Emily Climbs” seems like a singular story, but it’s actually two stories told by three actors playing the same character.

headline.main: Review: In ‘Emily Climbs (Machine Méchant),’ a Botched Rebirth

docs.abstract: Alexis Soloski reviews play Emily Climbs (Machine Mechant), performed by theater company Nellie Tinder with script by Julia May Jonas, at the Brick.
docs.snippet: “Emily Climbs” seems like a singular story, but it’s actually two stories told by three actors playing the same character.

docs.lead_paragraph: China is considering a ban on advertisements for infant milk formula in a bid to tackle low levels of breast feeding, the official Xinhua news agency said on Monday, a potential headache for firms targeting the country's near $18 billion (12 billion pounds) market.

docs.lead_paragraph: At Cornell, the benefits of having an on-campus dairy extend beyond a diverse dining hall menu to helping change workout recovery habits.

headline.main: Cornell’s Chocolate Milk Fills Refueling Gap
headline.print_headline: Cornell’s Chocolate Milk Fills Refueling Gap

docs.abstract: Cornell's own dairy processing plant has produced 1 percent low-fat chocolate milk that its athletes use for recovery; is now working on a protein drink called Big Red Refuel.
docs.snippet: At Cornell, the benefits of having an on-campus dairy extend beyond a diverse dining hall menu to helping change workout recovery habits.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fernando Cabada has quietly transformed himself into one of best distance runners in the United States, and one of the best Hispanic athletes the country has ever seen.

headline.main: A Marathoner Outruns a Childhood of Poverty
headline.print_headline: A Marathoner Outruns a Childhood of Poverty

docs.abstract: Profile of Latino marathoner Fernando Cabada, front-runner in upcoming Boston Marathon; Cabada, whose childhood in Fresno, Calif, was filled with trauma and poverty, has transformed himself into one of best distance runners in United States.
docs.snippet: Fernando Cabada has quietly transformed himself into one of best distance runners in the United States, and one of the best Hispanic athletes the country has ever seen.

docs.lead_paragraph: When the school bell rings, children file into classrooms and open their textbooks. Increasingly, they're also eating a bowl of cereal.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of breakfasts served in the nation's schools has doubled in the last two decades, a surge driven largely by a change in how districts deliver the food.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dana Perino, President George W. Bush's spokeswoman at the end of his presidency, is out with a book that is part memoir, part career advice. Perino is the only Republican woman ever to serve as White House press secretary and is now a co-cost of "The Five" on Fox News Channel.

headline.main: 5 Things From Former Bush Press Secretary Perino's Book
headline.print_headline: 5 Things From Former Bush Press Secretary Perino's Book

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal food inspectors have announced the recall of 1,920 pounds of sweet potato and chicken baby food made by Beech-Nut Nutrition, saying it may be contaminated with small pieces of glass.

headline.main: Beech-Nut Baby Food Recalled Over Fear of Glass Contamination
headline.print_headline: Beech-Nut Baby Food Recalled Over Fear of Glass Contamination

docs.snippet: Federal food inspectors have announced the recall of 1,920 pounds of sweet potato and chicken baby food made by Beech-Nut Nutrition, saying it may be contaminated with small pieces of glass.
